column1: #text=Yesterday I traveled from London in the United Kingdom to my home in Manchester .
#text=I visited a website for train times and tickets the day before .
#text=I knew when I needed to arrive in Manchester so I searched using my desired arrival time .
#text=I selected a ticket that worked for me and had the lowest price .
#text=I used my debit card to pay and selected the option to collect the ticket at the train station .
#text=I arrived at the train station in plenty of time because I know there can be long queues at the machines where tickets are collected .
#text=When it was my turn at the ticket machine , I followed the instructions and input my ticket reference number , which I had stored on my smartphone .
#text=The machine printed out my tickets and I picked them up , checking them to make sure they were correct .
#text=Next I needed to determine which platform my train would be departing from .
#text=I walked over to the large electronic display boards .
#text=Lots of destinations were listed and I had to wait a little while before Manchester showed up .
#text=There was more than one train to Manchester , so I confirmed which one was mine by the train company and the departure time .
#text=It said it would leave from Platform 6 so I followed the signs to the platform .
#text=Once at the platform I sat and waited until my train arrived .
#text=After all of the arriving people got off , I boarded the car indicated on my ticket and took my reserved seat , ready for the journey .
